page.title: 04A History of the School.
page.content: In 1910 Mr. Bates was at the National school in Great Brickhill which was opposite the shop and Post Office. They had 2 playgrounds. For heat they had an open coal fire. The head teacher was Mrs Jones. They had a tripod blackboard in the infant and junior classrooms. Sports day was always held at the manor belonging to the Duncombes. On the Queen's birthday they put up a flag on the school flagpole. On all the Saints days they went to church. There was no play school. The children went to school at about 5yrs old. The oldest was 14yrs. If they had been told off 3 times they would have a choice of the cane or slipper. If they were dirty they had their mouth washed out with soap and water. They went for a nature walk some times.
